summary: Para la versión de esta página en español, ver a GAO-22-105311 . Federal agencies faced unprecedented challenges responding to 2017's Hurricane Maria, which caused extensive damage in Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. The Federal Communications Commission's part included gathering network outage information and creating a task force to support communications restoration. We found unclear federal guidance on FCC's role in disaster response, which...
title: Telecommunications: FCC Assisted in Hurricane Maria Network Restoration, but a Clarified Disaster Response Role and Enhanced Communication Are Needed
